```{r cleaning-data}
# read data
storm <- read_csv("data/StormEvents_details-ftp_v1.0_d1971_c20160223.csv")

# change date format
storm$BEGIN_DATE_TIME <- dmy_hms(storm$BEGIN_DATE_TIME, tz="America") 
storm$END_DATE_TIME <- dmy_hms(storm$END_DATE_TIME, tz="America")
storm$BEGIN_DAY <- mday(storm$BEGIN_DATE_TIME)
storm$END_DAY <- mday(storm$END_DATE_TIME)
storm$BEGIN_TIME <- format(as.POSIXct(storm$BEGIN_DATE_TIME) ,format = "%H:%M:%S") 
storm$END_TIME <- format(as.POSIXct(storm$END_DATE_TIME) ,format = "%H:%M:%S") 
storm$MONTH_NAME <- month(storm$BEGIN_DATE_TIME, label=TRUE)

#unselect column with NA value; unselect BEGIN MONTH and END MONTH because there are already MONTH column
storm <- storm %>% select(-BEGIN_YEARMONTH, -END_YEARMONTH, -EPISODE_ID, -WFO, -CZ_TIMEZONE, -SOURCE, -MAGNITUDE_TYPE,-CATEGORY, -FLOOD_CAUSE,-TOR_OTHER_WFO,- TOR_OTHER_CZ_STATE, -TOR_OTHER_CZ_FIPS, - TOR_OTHER_CZ_NAME, - BEGIN_AZIMUTH, -BEGIN_LOCATION, -END_AZIMUTH, -END_LOCATION, -EPISODE_NARRATIVE, -EVENT_NARRATIVE, -DATA_SOURCE) 
```
